title: With Support Singed, Rengar, and Flex Queue, we all forgot....
body:
...that Riot actually listens. The new client has Match Replays, which can be accessed under the "Match History" tab. 

It might have been a long time in the making, but thanks!

replies.body:
They announced "replays coming soon" in 2012.

Its almost 2017. Lol

Yeah, well, things come up. My pure conjecture and baseless guess is that it probably has to do with the massive growth of the game - I mean, in 2012 LoL had a fraction of the players as it does now, and even back then they had some infrastructure problems in saving the millions of replays generated.

2012 was the year were league players had the highest play rate, with 32 million of people
2014 still had 32 million

and since then riot didn't publish numbers

so **No**

The only thing right about your post is that there were 32 million players in 2012. Whoever told you the rest is talking out of their ass. 

http://www.forbes.com/sites/jasonevangelho/2012/10/12/league-of-legends-bigger-than-wow-more-daily-players-than-call-of-duty/#4915bf1e6617

32 million in 2012

http://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2014/01/27/riots-league-of-legends-reveals-astonishing-27-million-daily-players-67-million-monthly/#73d5f2073511

67 million in 2014

http://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2016/09/13/riot-games-reveals-league-of-legends-has-100-million-monthly-players/#31946f2710b1

100 million in 2016
i don't care what your stupid link says, riot didn't publish numbers since 2014
"Oh, you have evidence that proves me wrong? I dont care what your stupid link says"

What is being said or shown:
so among [100 million players](http://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2016/09/13/riot-games-reveals-league-of-legends-has-100-million-monthly-players/#31946f2710b1), only [2 million](http://na.op.gg/ranking/ladder/), or 2% of the entire playerbase, plays ranked.
And also due to the enormous rise in LoL population, the queue times for bot mode has been increased from 5 seconds (2014) to a full 60 second (2016) over the 2 years

Yeah. That seems totally legit.

> [{quoted}](name=Sona x Rubick,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UKXvLktI,comment-id=00010000000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-17T17:39:01.595+0000)
>
> i don't care what your stupid link says, riot didn't publish numbers since 2014

> [{quoted}](name=ChaoticPinecone,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UKXvLktI,comment-id=000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-11-17T17:47:51.049+0000)
>
> "Oh, you have evidence that proves me wrong? I dont care what your stupid link says"

and i think there's a concrete evidence right here

_**edit**_:
1,966,386(NA) + 3,370,180(KR) + 98,123(JP) + 3,189,136(EUW) + 1,586,542(EUNE) + 234,358(OCE) + 1,177,292(BRZ) + 525,179(LAS) + 522,252(LAN) + 192,907(RUS) + 735,104(TRK)
= 13,597,459 Ranked users in total globally
= 13.6% of playerbase plays ranked (assuming all ranked users play monthly).

Personally im still not convinced with the [statement](http://www.forbes.com/sites/insertcoin/2016/09/13/riot-games-reveals-league-of-legends-has-100-million-monthly-players/#31946f2710b1) cuz that means _**at most**_ only 13.6% of the playerbase plays ranked (it should be way lower since there are players who no longer play but had been ranked for the season prior to quitting), unless each person owns an average of 10+ smurf accounts ~~which would be the most probable answer for bot mode queue time changes over past 2 years~~

A 5-seconds check on OP.GG seems to indicate that there are at least 3 millions players playing Ranked on EUW alone. The 100 million players is the global figure, the world doesn't end with the US, you know...

thx for pointing out my mistake, n i made edit to my original post. But im not sure if ≤13.6% is a believable number either.
But with the queue time comparison for bot mode, i still have a reason to believe "100 million monthly active players" is false.

Youre taking the stats of all ranked players who played ranked at some point in the season (13 million globally) and trying to draw a conclusion by comparing to unique monthly players. Of course its not 13.6% - its probably a lot lower. If youre going to take ranked players for an entire year, the only number thats relevant to compare that to is unique yearly players. 

13 million out of 100 million dont play ranked. 13 million out of however many unique yearly players play ranked. Your argument does 2 things - it inflates the number of ranked players (its season long, not monthly - unless, like you mentioned, all ranked players play monthly - which you also mentioned probably isnt true) then deflates the number of unique players (monthly, not season long - unless of course all players play monthly, which is also probably not true.).
and 86% of stats are made up on the spot
http://www.relatably.com/q/img/abraham-lincoln-believe-internet-quote/true-pr-quotes-from-us-presidents-and-one-thats-fake-by-prdotco-4-638.jpg

And the best part is they still have no plan of when cross-patch replays will be implemented, so the Riot replays are largely pointless and inferior to the existing 3rd party sites for replays anyways.

Meanwhile they still haven't re-implemented the item set builder either, which people actually do use in its original form and for which there ISN'T a 3rd party alternative.

Riot replays as currently intended to be implemented for the foreseeable future are a total waste of development time that should be redirected to something more productive. Like the item set builder.

the item set builder that like .03% of the community uses (that there IS a third party application for, multiple actually, all of which still work because under the hood item sets are the same) are a higher priority than... replays that people have been begging for since 2012.

Also, you're an idiot. The reason the full replay doesn't carry over to the next patch is because it doesn't need to - 

>Yep. Just click the red Record Button on the new Annotated Timeline to start recording, (watch your sick play), then click again to stop. We’re calling these video clips “Highlights” and they’re in the .webm format. Your Highlight will be saved on your computer in the following location:
>
>C:\Users\<Insert Your User Name Here>\Documents\LeagueofLegends\Highlights
>
>(This path is also displayed when we confirm the Highlight was captured after you stop your recording). From there, you can upload it wherever you’d like to share with all of your friends.

Why on earth would I need to carry over the archaic in-game version when I could just convert it to a video format directly in the client? 

What a waste of developer's resources, mirite?!

If it doesn't need to, why are there so many posts asking for it? Explain that, please. Hint: Being able to use the features that come with having it in a more detailed format than just rendered video may have something to do with it.

Furthermore, no, there is no workable replacement for the item set builder - I've looked. You know, as someone who actually uses the feature, along with a lot of other people who keep making posts about wanting the item set builder kept. Pretty vocal ".03%" apparently.

And yes, replays have been asked for since 2012. And implemented by third party sites. Better than Riot apparently intends to implement them in the game anytime soon. Which makes one ask, what possible point an inferior implementation has? What meaningful advantage do the current beta client replays have that somehow makes them better overall than the various 3rd party replays with more features?

I'm not going to call you an idiot, but I will admit, it IS tempting. And probably a lot more justified.

To your first question: People don't read. For the same reason that I had to tell the first 10 junglers after the patch that gromp spawns later and you have to start buff now, who were surprised that their smite didn't give buffs anymore or wondered what plants do. Reading comprehension is really, really low. Also, most 3rd party replay viewers don't fully support old replays anyway (and have the disadvantage of randomly breaking from patches or not working for days while the service is patched), so I don't really understand how it's inferior. It's beta - perhaps they'll update the code to allow cross patch replays.

To your item sets:

Not only can you actually create your own entirely independently of the client (https://developer.riotgames.com/docs/item-sets - you can even download a template and just replace with your own), you can also download from specific sites (Championify as mentioned in Riot's own newspost downloads the highest w/r sets from champion.gg https://github.com/dustinblackman/Championify , or you can download the ones you like with a chrome plug-in like LeagueSets https://chrome.google.com/webstore/detail/leaguesets/eoekgdlembbelehimiljbdnofnldepmc?hl=en-US ). So the idea that there are NO 3rd party options for item sets is actually false on principle - Riot has a document teaching you how to make your own right there.

Implying that the third party implementations have somehow been better (than Riot's current attempt that's been out for all of what, **a week?**... **in a beta client?**) when they've actually been riddled with bugs and graphical problems is absurd. I'd love a pair of your rose colored glasses!

You say people don't read, yet you completely ignore what you can do with a raw replay that you can't do with a raw video. Then you go on to equate not "fully" supporting old replays with not supporting old replays at all, and ignore the fact that Riot employees have explicitly stated they have no idea when or if they'll implement cross-patch replays at all, and that they refuse to discuss it further for now because it's "too soon," even to merely plan for the future.

Then you go on to equate an extremely impractical text-based format I doubt you could even use to make a meaningful number of item sets yourself in any reasonable period of time with being an adequate replacement for an existing far more time-efficient, user-friendly solution that doesn't require constantly cross-referencing raw numbers for items and their stats. Then you claim two other things that only import other peoples' item sets are a replacement for something which lets you create your own, a completely different function.

You are clearly and blatantly ignoring reality and reason on a regular basis in your posts in this thread, on top of insulting people for not holding your views.
Well in Riot time that's pretty soon

> [{quoted}](name=ChaoticPinecone,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UKXvLktI,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-11-17T07:58:49.830+0000)
>
> ...that Riot actually listens. The new client has Match Replays, which can be accessed under the &quot;Match History&quot; tab. 
> 
> It might have been a long time in the making, but thanks!

That's great and all, but frankly, they should have been out 4 years ago when they were announced as "practically finished". Plus, it's an incredibly basic feature that practically every other serious competitive game has. (Starcraft 2, Heroes of the Storm, DotA 2, and Counter-Strike: Global Offensive all function perfectly with no issues. SMITE has one that only functions 25% of the time, but still has the framework at a minimum.)

If anything, Riot should probably be forced to face the music for not having such an essential tool until JUST NOW, 4 years since they announced it as (and I quote again) "practically finished". What makes it even more hilariously stupid (besides the fact LoL is one of the top 3 eSports in the world) is that 3rd-parties have been providing the tool for YEARS, which isn't an excuse for Riot to not make the tools sooner.

I think it had something to do with the client being too old a program. There was no room to improve? Idk the details but I mean at least they hav it now. And actually, because other programs provided for it, thats probably why they didn't work on it at all, cuz third party programs already got it cover. I mean thats exactly wat they said about custom items sets not being in the new client.

> I think it had something to do with the client being too old a program.

I don't think so.

This excuse is used way too often.
I think it's a valid excuse though. The old client was shit
Then why bother annoucing it back in 2012.

First of all, it was in 2013. And they didnt "announce" it per se - they were testing an Alpha version on the PBE, where they kept it up for about a year or so. But they specifically stated they had problems with buggy replays/saving especially with backwards compatibility, and had some problems with support and infrastructure for saving replays for millions of games. 

And when they announced the Alpha version on the PBE, they specifically noted that in order for it to hit Live, they would have to go through numerous Beta cycles to work out all the bugs. So what they originally promised was that they were working on a replay system (they did) and it wasnt going to come soon (it didnt). 

Is 3.5 years a bit long? Yeah, it is. But its 3.5 years for a project they wanted to do for us, not for a project they promised to do for us.
They didn't want to do it for "us". They were forced by the competition.

valid.. Nope.

It's lazy excuse.

Yea, your right. When your client bugs up and they're having multiple malfunctions for something they have no control over, being too old a client to handle it, that's "lazy" not a valid reason. Im not saying it IS the reason but if that was why, I would understand. They clearly arnt lazy about it, they have released a brand new client, from the ground up, that can actually handle it so it's not like they didn't put their resources in to try and get that replay feature in. Btw on a side note, what gives me the hint of the client being too old is when they specifically said why they even wanted to make a new client. 

One: it doesn't fit the theme direction they like so they want something more modern
Two: it couldn't support any add ons,  like new game modes or new features that they wanted to implement.
I could have replays before. What we've been wanting is a queue that's free of premades. We haven't gotten that yet, and still won't even after the "solo" queue comes back.
really uninspired and dont care at this point

I feel like an official replay system isnt even needed. Anyone that wanted them could just go to replay.gg or other sites and saving the replays of every single person is gonna take a lot of data storage... room... thing.. right?

I'm meh on this one

because they listened a long time ago but found a problem that would enable hackers, so they didn't do it. Still, glad they finally found a way to get it done!

I wouldnt call implementing something players have asked for since day 1 as "listening" 
RIOT doesnt listen to us, you can tell because it takes them YEARS add to the game what people ask for. If 90% of board posts talking about nerfs are aimed at Yasuo, RIOT still wont care, they change the game to cater to what they want, what their chinese overlords want, and what the pros want, thats all it is

good job riot.
now, item sets please.

> [{quoted}](name=Aptest,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UKXvLktI,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-11-17T10:02:51.732+0000)
>
> good job riot.
> now, item sets please.

With uber rare drop rates from baron something like 3.86/44444444.444 Repeating ofc
Yeah, good job rito, you finally added a feature after seven years that Paragon already has in it's beta.

They didn't listen about the damage fervor will do to on hit champs, or the damage the jungle is doing to single target junglers with less than strong jungle clears, the boards called out the problem vayne will cause with duskblade before the patch even dropped, lets not forget all the regular complaints about lee even before they buffed him for worlds, it was called out jayce buff was a really bad idea....

the regular complaints about lee were dumb he wasn't even strong.

I don't trust these boards for anything resembling a fair analysis, they complained about zed for ages when he wasn't remotely op too.

Listens.... Yeah a couple years after it was brought in the spotlight and already implemented in other similar games (csgo, dota2). They used to listen tho I can't take that from Riot, time changed their ways I guess.

They listen about things that don't actually fix their game. 

They're unneeded features when their gameplay is currently suffering.

At this rate, damage will continue to be absurdly over-tuned across the board by the end of Season 7 as well.

{{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 

something positive for once ... instead of the same ole circle jerk of tears and bitching

> [{quoted}](name=MrFawknSunshine ,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UKXvLktI,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-11-17T08:01:11.959+0000)
>
> {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}} 
> 
> something positive for once ... instead of the same ole circle jerk of tears and bitching

The only thing I didn't approve of was banning the singed player. In many cases it shows how he actually did communicate and all he was doing was going off meta. If riot banned him for not supporting then that would be fair... except for that the "support" role is something that is part of the meta. The rules are too vague and the ones that ARE there contradict what Riot is saying. Besides it's sort of riots fault for not adding "off meta" "counter jg" "roam" etc etc as roles

what it boils down to... and im gonna get hell for this , people take this game to damn seriously... its meant to have fun and enjoy it... not to be taken as seriously as the community does or put that much weight into rank as they do. and if you do anything someone might seem as hurting their chances of winning or climbing rank in this pissing contest of the rank system creates they wanna cry, flame, rage, etc... we see it every other post on the boards. and to me at the end of the day this is what creates the toxic environment of the game.  now if someone intentionally  runs it down mid... flat out rages quits. verbally abusive , vulgar language hate speech etc is another animal... but legit trying something that is not the norm regardless of win or loss and people being hateful and toxic over that saying another player should have their privilege  of playing this game away from them is flat out stupid... we all encounter worst on a regular basis then what he did. and i have stated in another post i would rather take  a player like him then a player of the likes of tyler 1. support smite singed dont make me want to stop playing and uninstall the game... players like tyler 1 does .
i would trade replays for custom item sets

With Support Singed, Rengar, Flex Queue and a sub-par, shitty, forced replay system, we all forgot that Item Sets will not be added in the near future and that Solo Queue re-release is 5 days late without any word from Riot.

They listen shit.

I know DST is your fetish, but it also makes you blind.
And they made the in game TAB list in order.
games dead, riot isnt even bothering trying to fix it. they love it when we ban and report each other. they make more money that way

> [{quoted}](name=ChaoticPinecone,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UKXvLktI,comment-id=,timestamp=2016-11-17T07:58:49.830+0000)
>
> ...that Riot actually listens. The new client has Match Replays, which can be accessed under the &quot;Match History&quot; tab. 
> 
> It might have been a long time in the making, but thanks!

that was runoff from actually listening years ago...
